Structs/Error.html#/s:FV6Siesta5ErrorcFT.abstract: Initializes the error using an underlying error.

Structs/Error/Cause.html.name: Cause
Structs/Error/Cause.html.abstract: Underlying causes of errors reported by Siesta. You will find these on the Error.cause property.

Structs/Error.html#/s:vV6Siesta5Error30e.abstract: Typed content accessors such as .text and .jsonDict apply to entity?.content.

Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity7.name: content
Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity7.abstract: The data itself. When constructed from an HTTP response, it begins its life as NSData, but may become any type

Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity1.name: contentType
Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity1.abstract: The type of data contained in the content.

Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity7.abstract: The charset given with the content type, if any.

Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity4.name: etag
Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity4.abstract: The etag of this data. If non-nil, Siesta will send an If-None-Match header with subsequent loads.

Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity9.name: timestamp
Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity9.abstract: The time at which this data was last known to be valid.

Structs/Entity.html#/s:FV6Siesta6Entity6.name: header(_:)
Structs/Entity.html#/s:FV6Siesta6Entity6.abstract: Returns the value of the HTTP header with the given key.

Structs/Entity.html#/s:vV6Siesta6Entity3.abstract: Typed content accessors such as .text and .jsonDict apply to this entity’s content.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: service
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: The API to which this resource belongs. Provides configuration defaults and instance uniqueness.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: latestData
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: The latest valid data we have for this resource. May come from a server response, a cache,

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: latestError
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Details if the last attempt to load this resource resulted in an error. Becomes nil as soon

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: timestamp
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: The time of the most recent update to either latestData or latestError.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: isLoading
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: True if any load requests (i.e. from calls to load(...) and loadIfNeeded())

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: isRequesting
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: True if any requests for this resource are in progress.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: loadRequests
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: All load requests in progress, in the order they were initiated.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: allRequests
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: All requests in progress related to this resource, in the order they were initiated.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: child(_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Returns the resource with the given string appended to the path of this resource’s URL, with a joining slash

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: relative(_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Returns the resource with the given URL, using this resource’s URL as the base if it is a relative URL.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: optionalRelative(_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Returns relative(href) if href is present, and nil if href is nil.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: withParam(_:_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Returns this resource with the given parameter added or changed in the query string.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Initiates a network request for the given resource.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: isUpToDate
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: True if the resource’s local state is up to date according to staleness configuration.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: loadIfNeeded()
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Ensures that there is a load request in progress for this resource, unless the resource is already up to date.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: load()
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Initiates a GET request to update the state of this resource.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: load(usingRequest:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Updates the state of this resource using the result of the given request. Use this method when you want a request

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: cancelLoadIfUnobserved()
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: If this resource has no observers, cancels all loadRequests.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: cancelLoadIfUnobserved(afterDelay:callback:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Convenience to call cancelLoadIfUnobserved() after a delay. Useful for situations such as table view scrolling

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: overrideLocalData(_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Directly updates latestData without touching the network. Clears latestError and broadcasts

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: overrideLocalContent(_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Convenience method to replace the content of latestData without altering the content type or other headers.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: invalidate()
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Forces the next call to loadIfNeeded() to trigger a request, even if the current content is fresh.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: wipe()
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Resets this resource to its pristine state, as if newly created.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: addObserver(_:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Adds an self-owned observer to this resource, which will receive notifications of changes to resource state.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: addObserver(_:owner:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Adds an observer to this resource, holding a strong reference to it as long as owner still exists.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: addObserver(owner:closure:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Adds a closure observer to this resource.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.name: removeObservers(ownedBy:)
Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Removes all observers owned by the given object.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Convenience method to initiate a request with a text body.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Convenience method to initiate a request with a JSON body.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Convenience method to initiate a request with URL-encoded parameters in the meesage body.

Classes/Resource.html#/s:ZFC6Siesta8Reso.abstract: Returns a request for this resource that immedately fails, without ever touching the network. Useful for creating

Classes/Resource.html#/s:FC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Matches this specific resource when passed as a pattern to Service.configure(...).

Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.name: entityForTypedContentAccessors
Classes/Resource.html#/s:vC6Siesta8Resou.abstract: Typed content accessors such as .text and .jsonDict apply to latestData?.content.

Classes/Service.html#/s:vC6Siesta7Servic.name: baseURL
Classes/Service.html#/s:vC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: The root URL of the API. If nil, then resource(_:) will only accept absolute URLs.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Creates a new service for the given API.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: resource(_:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Returns the unique resource with the given path appended to the path component of baseURL.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: resource(absoluteURL:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Returns the unique resource with the given URL, ignoring baseURL.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: resource(absoluteURL:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Returns the unique resource with the given URL string, ignoring baseURL.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: configure(_:requestMethods:description:configurer:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Applies configuration to resources whose URLs match a given pattern.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: configure(whenURLMatches:requestMethods:description:configurer:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Applies configuration to resources whose URL matches an arbitrary predicate.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: configureTransformer(_:requestMethods:description:contentTransform:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Transforms responses by passing their content through the given closure. This is a shortcut for adding a

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: invalidateConfiguration()
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Signals that all resources need to recompute their configuration next time they need it.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: wipeResources(_:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Wipes the state of all this service’s resources. Typically used to handle logout.

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: wipeResources(_:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Wipes resources based on a URL pattern. For example:

Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.name: wipeResourcesMatchingURL(_:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:FC6Siesta7Servic.abstract: Wipes the state of a subset of this service’s resources, matching based on URLs (instead of Resource instances).

Classes/Service.html.abstract: A set of logically connected RESTful resources, grouped under a base URL. Resources within a service share caching,

Classes/Resource.html.name: Resource
Classes/Resource.html.abstract: An in-memory cache of a RESTful resource, plus information about the status of network requests related to it.

Structs/Entity.html.abstract: An HTTP entity. Consists of data content plus metadata about

Structs/Configuration.html.name: Configuration
Structs/Configuration.html.abstract: Options which control the behavior of a Resource.

Protocols/ConfigurationPatternConvertibl.abstract: A type that can serve as a URL matcher for service configuration.
